title: Dillian Whyte makes brutal comparison between Deontay Wilder and KSI and Logan Paul
text:
Wilder is the reigning WBC heavyweight champion (Picture: Getty)

Dillian Whyte aimed a swipe at Deontay Wilder from the press conference of KSI’s rematch with Logan Paul.

The British heavyweight was in attendance for the Youtubers’ media tour which touched down in London on Monday evening.

Thousands of fans packed inside London’s Troxy to catch a glimpse of the warring internet personalities and Whyte has placed himself firmly in KSI’s camp.

Whyte was asked backstage about the magnitude of the event and ‘the Bodysnatcher’ could not help a quick jab at WBC champion Wilder.

KSI and Logan held a packed press conference in London (Picture: Reuters)

He told IFLTV: ‘Respect to you guys and what you’ve done for boxing.

‘There’s more people here than at most professional fights, [more] than Deontay Wilder’s fights.’

KSI and Logan fight again in November, this time in Los Angeles, but Whyte himself in the midst of a doping scandal.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Whyte failed a UKAD test before his last bout against Oscar Rivas, but was then cleared to fight and came out victorious in a thrilling encounter.

It emerged after that fight Whyte had tested positive for a banned substance and the 31-year-old is now in a legal battle to clear his name.

Eddie Hearn has insisted his fighter is innocent of any wrongdoing and Whyte declared he wanted to return to the ring in December.

Whyte plans to fight in December (Picture: Getty)

‘I can fight and I will fight. I will be fighting this year. I’d like to fight in December,’ Whyte said, pointing out he is not serving any kind of doping ban.

‘Every time I’m rising, something else tries to bring me down. But that’s boxing.

‘My whole career has been mad ups and down. It’s stressful. Boxing is hard anyway without the problems. It is what it is.

‘Sometimes it’s hard when people pretend their on your side and then turn against at the drop of the hat.’
description: Dillian Whyte aimed a swipe at Deontay Wilder from the press conference of KSI's rematch with Logan Paul. The British heavyweight was in attendance for the Youtubers' media tour which...
